title: Manchin Pulls Plug on Climate and Tax Talks, Shrinking Domestic Plan
abstract: The West Virginia Democrat’s decision dealt a crushing blow to President Biden’s domestic agenda, effectively ruling out action on anything beyond prescription drug pricing and health care subsidies.
byline: By Emily Cochrane and Lisa Friedman
des_facet: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

multimedia.caption: Sen. Joe Manchin III, led his own party through months of tortured negotiations that collapsed Thursday night, when Democratic leaders said Manchin rejected all the climate provisions in a proposed spending bill.
multimedia.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

title: ‘Snooki’ Is Enlisted in John Fetterman’s Campaign Trolling Dr. Oz
abstract: “I don’t know why anyone would want to leave Jersey,” the former “Jersey Shore” star said in a video posted by Mr. Fetterman.

multimedia.caption: John Fetterman campaigning in Pennsylvania in May, before a stroke that has kept him off the campaign trail. He’s posting memes on Twitter instead.

title: Here’s How Democrats’ Big Domestic Agenda Bill Has Shrunk
abstract: Proposed as a transformative, multitrillion-dollar plan with cradle-to-grave programs, Democrats’ domestic policy bill has been whittled down to a shadow of its former self.

multimedia.caption: It now appears Democrats’ plan will not go beyond lowering the cost of prescription drugs and extending Affordable Care Act subsidies after Senator Joe Manchin III dealt it yet another blow on Thursday.
multimedia.copyright: Haiyun Jiang/The New York Times

title: Secret Service Text Messages Around Jan. 6 Were Erased, Inspector General Says
abstract: The disclosure drew concern from the House committee investigating the attack, which has heard testimony that President Donald J. Trump wanted agents to take him to the Capitol that day.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

multimedia.caption: “It’s important for us to get as much information about how this discrepancy occurred,” said Bennie Thompson, the chairman of the House Jan. 6 committee.

title: ‘Top Gun: Maverick’ Enters the Pantheon of Conservative Fan Fiction
abstract: The American right has embraced Tom Cruise’s latest blockbuster, hailing the movie as a patriotic gesture produced in defiance of “woke” liberal elites and the Chinese Communist Party.
byline: By Blake Hounshell and Marc Tracy

multimedia.caption: In “Top Gun: Maverick,” Tom Cruise trains a group of young pilots for a dangerous mission against an unidentified hostile country.

title: House Passes $840 Billion Military Policy Bill
abstract: The House moved to increase President Biden’s requested Pentagon budget by $37 billion, reflecting a growing bipartisan appetite in Congress to raise military spending.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

multimedia.caption: Representative Andy Biggs argued that a bill amendment to combat extremism in the military “attempts to create a problem where none exists” and “denigrates our men and women in the service.”

title: In an era of alphabet soup diplomacy, Biden is adding ingredients.
abstract: Unsettled times have brought a proliferation of new clusters of various countries, and the acronyms that come with them.

multimedia.caption: President Biden has contributed to a growth in diplomatic jargon. New alliances in his time as POTUS include IPEF, MEAD and now I2U2.

title: John R. Froines, Chemist and Member of the Chicago Seven, Dies at 83
abstract: After his acquittal for inciting a riot at the 1968 Democratic National Convention, he became a leading environmental toxicologist, shaping government standards on lead and diesel exhaust.

multimedia.caption: John R. Froines in 1969. He was a member of the famed Chicago Seven, the group accused of conspiring to incite a riot during the 1968 Democratic National Convention.
multimedia.copyright: Stephen Deutch/Chicago History Museum, via Getty Images

title: Texas Sues Biden Administration Over Access to Emergency Medical Abortions
abstract: Recent administrative guidance to hospitals said doctors could perform abortions in emergency situations if complications posed a threat to the health or life of the mother.
byline: By J. David Goodman and Sheryl Gay Stolberg

multimedia.caption: Attorney General Ken Paxton of Texas filed a lawsuit on Thursday challenging federal guidance that he said would “force abortions” in hospitals in the state.

title: Democrats Face Deepening Peril as Republicans Seize on Inflation Fears
abstract: Economists warn that a blitz of midterm election campaign ads could push consumer prices even higher.

multimedia.caption: Republicans across the country are investing heavily in campaign advertisements that portray a dark sense of economic disarray and blame President Biden and the Democrats for rapid inflation.

title: Judge Issues Arrest Warrant for Tina Peters, the Colorado County Clerk Under Indictment
abstract: Ms. Peters, the Mesa County clerk accused of overseeing a breach of election equipment, went to Las Vegas this week to speak at an event. A judge said the trip violated her bond conditions.

multimedia.caption: Tina Peters spoke at a rally in May hosted by former President Donald J. Trump in Casper, Wyo. She has become a celebrity in conservative circles.

title: For Young Offenders, Restitution Debts Can Present Crippling Obstacles
abstract: A new report asserts that ordering juvenile offenders to pay compensation to their victims often derails their lives, and victims’ rights groups see shortcomings as well.

multimedia.caption: Ms. Guevara has been off probation for more than a year; she has had no encounters with the police. She said she thinks about her victims often, particularly an elderly man whose car she stole.

title: Young Voters Are Fed Up With Their (Much) Older Leaders
abstract: Led by politicians often three times their age, many voters under 30 are hungry for new blood and new ideas.
byline: By Maya King and Jonathan Weisman

multimedia.caption: Denange Sanchez, a 20-year-old college student from Palm Bay, Fla., said that despite President Biden’s promises, opportunities have still not materialized.

title: House Passes Bill to Expand Health Benefits for Burn Pit Exposure
abstract: The legislation would make millions of veterans exposed to the toxic pits eligible for medical and nursing home care, one of the largest expansions of benefits in history.
byline: By Stephanie Lai and John Ismay

multimedia.caption: Open-air burn pits were standard on American military bases in desert war zones such as Afghanistan and Iraq starting in 2001.

title: Jan. 6 and the Search for Direct Trump Links
abstract: The House panel investigating the Capitol riot has yet to find a proverbial smoking gun directly connecting the former president to the extremist groups that led the storming of the building. Is there one?
byline: By Blake Hounshell and Alan Feuer
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

multimedia.caption: The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack has scrutinized connections between Trump allies like Michael Flynn, a former national security adviser, and far-right groups like the Oath Keepers.
multimedia.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

title: Jan. 6 Panel Will Turn Over Evidence on Fake Electors to the Justice Dept.
abstract: The department has asked the House committee investigating the Capitol attack to share transcripts regarding the false electors scheme, the only topic it has broached with the panel.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

multimedia.caption: The House committee investigating Jan. 6 is “in the process of negotiating” the use of its evidence with the Justice Department, the panel’s chairman said on Wednesday.

title: Biden, Battered at Home, Basks in Unvarnished Praise in Israel
abstract: The U.S. president, on the first day of a trip to the Mideast, received the sort of rapturous welcome he can only dream about in Washington.
byline: By Peter Baker, Patrick Kingsley and Isabel Kershner

multimedia.caption: President Biden with his arm around Isaac Herzog, Israel’s president, as he talks with two Holocaust survivors at Yad Vashem in Jerusalem on Wednesday.

title: Statue of Black Educator Replaces Confederate General in U.S. Capitol
abstract: Mary McLeod Bethune is the first Black American to be represented with a state statue in the National Statuary Hall. Her likeness replaces a statue honoring one of the last Confederate generals to surrender.

multimedia.caption: By replacing a statue honiring a Confederate general with one celebrating Mary McLeod Bethune, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the Capitol was “trading a traitor for a civil rights hero.”
multimedia.copyright: Haiyun Jiang/The New York Times

multimedia.caption: By replacing a statue honiring a Confederate general with one celebrating Mary McLeod Bethune, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the Capitol was “trading a traitor for a civil rights hero.”

title: Inflation Soared in June, Pinching Consumers and Challenging Policymakers
abstract: Prices climbed 9.1 percent from a year earlier, ramping up pressure on the Federal Reserve to continue raising interest rates.

multimedia.caption: Prices surged 9.1 percent in June as consumers faced rapidly rising costs in groceries.

title: As Faith Flags in U.S. Government, Many Voters Want to Upend the System
abstract: Desire for structural changes cuts across both parties, a Times/Siena College poll found, but for starkly different reasons. Even Democrats now question if the government is a force for good.

multimedia.copyright: By The New York Times

title: Key Revelations From the Jan. 6 Hearings
abstract: The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack is laying out evidence that could allow prosecutors to indict former President Donald J. Trump, though the path to a criminal trial is uncertain. Here are the main themes that have emerged in each hearing.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
